detaileddescription.para: Link interface: Reduced media independent interface
Power management events that triggers a PMT interrupt
Driver is busy and cannot handle request
Driver could not fulfil application request
Indicates that the seconds value of the timestamp has overflowed beyond 0xFFFFFFFF
Indicates that the value of system time is greater or equal to the value specified in the Target_Time_ Seconds Register and Target Time Nanoseconds Register
Set when the target time, being programmed in Target Time Registers, is already elapsed
Generate event when frame is transmitted

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address
Correction factor

simplesect.para: The function can be used to adjust the PTP clock (time synchronization). Please see the function implementation for more information.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address
The status of which event (or a combination of logically OR'd events) needs to be cleared

simplesect.para: The function clears the status of an event passed as a parameter to the function.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function asserts the peripheral reset.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function sets the DAIF bitfield of the MAC_FRAME_FILTER register. It can be used to perform normal filtering of frames.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address
Which event (or a combination of logically OR'd events) needs to be disabled?

simplesect.para: The function can be used to disable ETH MAC event(s).

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function can be used to disable frame bursting.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function sets the RA bitfield of the MAC_FRAME_FILTER register. This ensures that the receiver module passes all received frames, irrespective of whether they pass the address filter or not.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function can be used to disable jumbo frames.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function can be used to disable the loopback mode.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function disables multicast hash filtering. The MAC performs a perfect destination address filtering for multicast frames post invocation.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function disables the power down mode of the ETH MAC.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address
A valid ETH PMT event (XMC_ETH_MAC_PMT_EVENT_t) or a valid combination of logically OR'd events

simplesect.para: The function disables the event(s) that trigger(s) a PMT interrupt.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function disables the promiscuous mode.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The timestamp interrupt is generated when the System Time becomes greater than the value written in the Target Time register (Alarm). After the generation of the Timestamp Trigger Interrupt, the interrupt is disabled.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function sets the DBF bitfield of the MAC_FRAME_FILTER register. When set, the AFM module filters all incoming broadcast frames. In addition, it overrides all other filter settings.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function disables the reception of multicast frames. When invoked, the AFM module passes all received broadcast frames.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function disables the receive process.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: On invocation of the function, the MAC disables the reception of frames in the half-duplex mode.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function disables the RX watchdog by disabling the timer on the RX.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function resets the SAF bitfield of the MAC_FRAME_FILTER register. Verbatim from the reference manual - "When invoked, the MAC forwards the received frame to the application and updates the SA Match bit of the RxStatus depending on the SA address comparison".

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function resets the SAIF bitfield of the MAC_FRAME_FILTER register. Verbatim from the reference manual - "When invoked, frames whose SA does not match the SA registers are marked as failing the SA Address filter".

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function disables the transmit process.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: When the function is invoked, the MAC disables the jabber timer on TX.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function disables unicast hash filtering. When invoked, the MAC performs a perfect destination address filtering for unicast frames.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function de-asserts the peripheral reset.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function sets the DAIF bitfield of the MAC_FRAME_FILTER register. Verbatim from the reference manual - "When invoked, the address check block operates in inverse filtering mode for the DA address comparison for both unicast and multicast frames".

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address
Which event (or a combination of logically OR'd events) needs to be enabled?

simplesect.para: The function can be used to enable ETH MAC event(s).

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function can be used to enable frame bursting during transmission in the MII half-duplex mode.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function resets the RA bitfield of the MAC_FRAME_FILTER register. This ensures that the receiver module passes only those frames (to the application) that pass the SA or DA address filter.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function sets the HPF bitfield of the MAC_FRAME_FILTER register. The function configures the address filter to pass a frame if it matches either the perfect filtering or the hash filtering.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function can be used to enable jumbo frames. When enabled, the MAC allows jumbo frames of 9,018 bytes without reporting a giant frame error in the receive frame status.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function enables the MAC to operate in the loopback mode using the MII.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: When invoked, the MAC performs destination address filtering of received multicast frames according to the hash table.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function clears the HPF bitfield of the MAC_FRAME_FILTER register. When the function is invoked, the frame is passed only if it matches the hash filter.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function enables the power down mode of the ETH MAC.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address
A valid ETH PMT event (XMC_ETH_MAC_PMT_EVENT_t) or a valid combination of logically OR'd events

simplesect.para: The function enables the event(s) that trigger(s) a PMT interrupt.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function enables the promiscuous mode. In this mode, the address filter module passes all incoming frames regardless of its destination or source address.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The timestamp interrupt is generated when the System Time becomes greater than the value written in the Target Time register (Alarm). After the generation of the Timestamp Trigger Interrupt, the interrupt is disabled.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: This function enables the AFM module to pass all received broadcast frames.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function sets the DBF bitfield of the MAC_FRAME_FILTER register. When set, the AFM module filters all incoming broadcast frames. In addition, it overrides all other filter settings.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function enables the receiver state machine of the MAC and puts the receive process in running state. The DMA then acquires the descriptor from the receive list and processes the received frames.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function enables the MAC to receive all packets that are given by the PHY while transmitting.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function enables the RX watchdog by clearing the WD bitfield of the MAC_CONFIGURATION register. When invoked, the MAC does not allow more than 2048 bytes of the frame being received.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function sets the SAF bitfield of the MAC_FRAME_FILTER register. Verbatim from the reference manual - "When invoked, the MAC compares the SA field of the received frames with the values programmed in the enabled SA registers. If the comparison matches, then the SA Match bit of RxStatus Word is set high. When this bit is set high and the SA filter fails, the MAC drops the frame.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function resets the SAIF bitfield of the MAC_FRAME_FILTER register. Verbatim from the reference manual - "When invoked, the address check block operates in inverse filtering mode for the SA address comparison. The frames whose SA matches the SA registers are marked as failing the SA Address filter".

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function enables the transmit state machine of the MAC and puts the transmit process in running state. The DMA then checks the TX list at the current position for transmitting a frame.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: When the function is invoked, the MAC cuts off the transmitter if the application sends out more than 2,048 bytes of data during transmission (10,240 bytes if jumbo frames are enabled)

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function enables the MAC to perform destination address filtering of unicast frames according to the hash table.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function initializes the RX DMA descriptors and enables the DMA transmission.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

simplesect.para: The function initializes the TX DMA descriptors and enables the DMA transmission.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ETH_MAC_t, pointing to the ETH MAC base address

The module needs to be enabled before using XMC_ETH_MAC_Enable()

simplesect.para: Set hash filter for group address filtering
The function sets up a hash filter for group address filtering. It writes the given hash value into the HASH_TABLE_LOW and HASH_TABLE_HIGH registers.

simplesect.para: The function reads a PHY register. It essentially writes the data and polls the busy bit until it is no longer busy.

detaileddescription.para: RDES0 Descriptor RX Packet StatusOwn bit 1=DMA, 0=CPU
TDES0 Descriptor TX Packet Control/StatusOwn bit 1=DMA, 0=CPU

briefdescription.para: Ethernet Low level driver for XMC4000 microcontroller family.

detaileddescription.para: The Ethernet MAC (ETH) is a major communication peripheral that supports 10/100 MBit/s data transfer rates in compliance with the IEEE 802.3-2002 standard. The ETH may be used to implement internet connected applications using IPv4 and IPv6. The ETH also includes support for IEEE1588 time synchronisation to allow implementation of Real Time Ethernet protocols.
The XMC_ETH_MAC low level driver provides functions to configure and initialize the ETH_MAC hardware peripheral.
